author: Vivek Narayanan
text:
A resident of Kannagi Nagar has lodged a complaint with the city police commissioner’s office alleging that a group of policemen had assaulted his 17-year-old son, mistaking him for a cell phone thief. Commissioner of Police T.K.Rajendran has tasked his team to provide a detailed report on the issue in a day’s time.

The teenager, Ganesh (name changed), is the third son of Vincent, a daily wage earner and Sumathi, residing in Kannagi Nagar. After his VII standard, Ganesh dropped out of school and started assisting his father at Pudupet.

“On Friday night, when he was about to have dinner, a few persons claiming to be policemen came to the house and dragged him away. They took him in a jeep,” said Mr. Vincent told The Hindu.

Mr. Vincent was asked to come to the Mylapore police station. “We went there and found he was not there. Then, we went to other police stations, but could not find him. Around 1 a.m on Saturday, my eldest son called me and said Ganesh had returned home,” added Sumathi.

Mr. Vincent found Ganesh badly injured and could not speak properly. He had injuries on his lips and torso and was unable to eat.

“Ganesh, after undergoing treatment, told us that the policemen blindfolded him and beat him up. Based on a conversation between the policemen, he suspected that he was near the Velachery railway station. He also heard them say that they picked up the wrong person on charges of stealing cell phones and dropped him near the Thoraipakkam signal,” alleged Vincent.

The police claim there are cases of theft against the teenager.

Kannagi Nagar resident lodges complaint with Chennai police
title: Mistaken for thief, teenager beaten up
